description: Oslo, the capital of Norway, enjoys a temperate climate with mild summers and cool winters.
Bergen is known for its rainy climate, with an average of 230 rainy days per year.
Tromsø is located above the Arctic Circle and experiences a subarctic climate with long, cold winters.
Trondheim, the third-largest city in Norway, has a temperate oceanic climate with warm summers and cool winters.
Stavanger is a coastal city in southwestern Norway, known for its mild, maritime climate.
